column1: When he was about eight or nine years of age
column2: his mother took her children to live for a time upon property owned by her family on the shore of Lake Sebago
column3: in Maine. Then began a period of great delight for the young boy and his sisters. As the land was mostly covered with woods and the settlements were far apart
column4: there were endless opportunities for fishing and hunting and roaming about the woods or spending long
column5: uninterrupted hours with favorite authors. In the winter Nathaniel passed much time in skating on Lake Sebago
column6: feeling wholly free and at home in the midst of the wild life of nature.So far as the boy's wishes were concerned
column7: these days in Maine might have continued indefinitely; but his mother
column8: feeling that he needed the discipline of regular study
column9: sent him back to Salem to be prepared by a private teacher for entrance into Bowdoin College.
